### Computation with Categories

```{python}
np.random.seed(111)
```

```{python}
draws = np.random.randn(1000)
```

```{python}
bins = pd.qcut(draws, 4)
```

```{python}
bins
```

```{python}
bins = pd.qcut(draws, 4, labels = ['Q1', 'Q2', 'Q3', 'Q4'])
```

```{python}
bins
```

```{python}
bins.codes[:5]
```

```{python}
bins_1 = pd.Series(bins, name = 'quantile')
```

```{python}
results = pd.Series(draws).groupby(bins_1).agg(['count', 'min', 'max']).reset_index()
```

```{python}
results
```

#### Better performance with categorials

```{python}
N = 10000000
```

```{python}
draws = pd.Series(np.random.randn(N))
```

```{python}
labels = pd.Series(['pen', 'ruler', 'book','cake'] * (N//4))
```

```{python}
categories = labels.astype('category')
```

```{python}
labels.memory_usage()
```

```{python}
categories.memory_usage()
```

GroupBy operations can be significantly faster with categoricals because the underly‚Äêing algorithms use the integer-based codes array instead of an array of strings.

cat_s

cats2

## 12.2 Advanced GroupBy Use

```{python}
df = pd.DataFrame({'key': ['a', 'b', 'c'] * 4, 'value': np.arange(12.)})
```

```{python}
df
```

```{python}
g = df.groupby('key').value
```

```{python}
g.mean()
```

```{python}
g.transform(lambda x: x.mean())
```

```{python}
g.transform('mean')
```

```{python}
g.transform(lambda x: x * 2)
```

```{python}
g.transform(lambda x: x.rank(ascending = False))
```

```{python}
def normalize(x):
    return (x - x.mean()) / x.std()
```

```{python}
g.transform(normalize)
```

```{python}
g.apply(normalize)
```

### Grouped Time Resampling

```{python}
N = 15
```

```{python}
times = pd.date_range('2017-05-20 00:00', freq='1min', periods=N)
```

```{python}
df = pd.DataFrame({'time': times, 'value': np.arange(N)})
```

```{python}
df
```

```{python}
df.set_index('time').resample('5min').count()
```

```{python}
df2 = pd.DataFrame({'time': times.repeat(3),
....: 'key': np.tile(['a', 'b', 'c'], N),
....: 'value': np.arange(N * 3.)})
```

```{python}
df2
```

```{python}
time_key = pd.TimeGrouper('5min')
```

```{python}
resampled = (df2.set_index('time')
....: .groupby(['key', time_key])
....: .sum())
```

```{python}
resampled
```

```{python}
resampled.reset_index()
```
